review_title: Working for Obama for America was a life changing experience!
pros: The knowledge I gained working for Obama for America was priceless. I have been getting constant job offers since the 2012 election, because of my experience working for the campaign.
cons: I never worked as hard in my life as I did for Obama for America. Persistence really does pay, though. Through the Obama for America campaign I was able to see the fruits of my labor every day, which motivated me to work harder and harder each day. By Election Day I was so exhausted I could barely function, but President Obama was reelected and that made all those sleepless nights well worth it.

job_title: Deputy Field Organizer in Tampa, FL
pros: If you are goal oriented, enjoy a real challenge and are looking to grow -- this is a great place. Great network of bright, talented, hard-working, talented people. You go through a large number of experiences in a short amount of time. Professional and personal growth is unrivaled. If you are driven by a cause, you will find immense satisfaction in the work that you do.
cons: Like most organizing jobs, the hours are long, the pressure is grueling and the pay is not the greatest. But going in, you should already know that. For a lot of people, this is easy to ignore if they are driven and excited enough.

job_title: Field Organizer in New York, NY
pros:
- Fast-paced learning environment. Almost every field organizer was no older than 25 and from a target school with incredible credentials.
- Networking opportunities were nearly incessant.
- Getting to meet some incredible people, from celebrity supporters to President Obama's travel aides, to the President himself.
cons:
- The hours were incredibly challenging. There were literally no days off, and weekends were often more demanding than weekdays.
- Incessant travel. Went to PA at least once a week, along with OH, NY, FL, and NH.
- The higher-ups could be really demanding and a bit cold; this was a campaign, so the focus is very quantitative. They cared more about numbers, not so much about you.

review_title: Hard work for a good cause
pros:
-You have a chance to interact with people in the community
-You have chances to interact with celebrity surrogates 
-lots of opportunities to learn something new
-the reward of the work you put in is nice
-working with young, talented, smart, democrats
cons:
-long hours, usually 10 hours a day
-in the heat of the campaign, not much time for a social life
-rapid response duties arise very often

review_title: Working on a Presidential Campaign is a must at some point in your life
pros: Exceptional colleagues (best and brightest as well as ppl wanting to do good); Startup like environment (5->millions of employees (including vols) over course of campaign); Incredible experiences (Winning/losing, collaborating with celebrities/surrogates, etc.)
cons: 100h weeks; some industry folk hold it in high regard upon exit, but others might (a) think you're partison or (b) not see the translated skills (there are many but they might just put it in mental box for 'politics'.

review_title: If you're new to organizing, this is a great place to develop your skills.
pros: Well resourced, developed grassroots structure. When you connect with experienced staff members, the development of organizing skills can be incredibly beneficial as this sort of relationship is encouraged by the organization.
cons: Command structure can be extremely rigid and unwelcoming of innovation, especially when local leadership consists of 20-somethings who haven't developed their workplace management skills, thereby making them hostile to any slightly negative (but very much constructive) feedback in the workplace.

pros: Working for a good cause with good people. Fast paced environment with positive can-do people. The work is hard but at least you know that it'll be over after the election. Get to staff events that the President is at.
cons: Dedicate your life to this position. 90+ hours a week. Seven days a week. There seems to be very little to no promoting from within. There is also a high turn over rate that can be discouraging.

review_title: An excellent organization with demanding, rewarding work
pros: The shared sense of mission was incredible strong. And there was no room for dead weight or error, meaning that the group of people I worked with were some of the most intelligent I've ever met. I'd work with those people for the rest of my life, if I could.
cons: It consumes your life. I'm glad I was young and didn't have children or other family members to attend to.

review_title: A fast-paced and challenging work environment that rewards talent.
pros: Passionate and intelligent staff works hard to achieve common goals. Staff is diverse in background and can give much insight to those just starting out.
cons: Long hours and poor work life balance can make long term employment difficult, however this is no different than other jobs in this career at this level.

pros:
Inspiring Co Workers
Fought for deeply progressive issues 
A chance to really develop political organizing skills
cons: As a fellow, I felt like there could have been more structure and more training. I sometimes felt like I was alone on an island, and especially given that this organization was just starting, i didn't have much of a base to work with. Also phone banking is absolutely draining. However, it was a good experience overall.

review_title: All work and no play makes America a free country.
pros:
Good field work training
Strong organizer program
lots of good lip service in the media etc.
cons:
Low pay
Long hours
Often they want you to contribute your personal assets. (let them use your vehicle, no gas reimbursement etc)

pros: Excellent experience all around - you learn to solve problems, communicate with lots of different types of people, learn about campaign organizing and strategy
cons: Low pay, long hours.  Extremely fast-paced environment, lots of menial tasks, but lots of cool opportunities to outweigh the downsides.

pros: Worked with good people. My state director was wonderful. I made some connections for the future.
cons: Like many organizing jobs the pay was not great and the hours too long. The contract was for only 3 months, which felt like not enough time to accomplish the program goals, and it was a constant scramble.

review_title: Fast paced, demanding and absolutely worth it!
pros: The ability to make a difference in the within the local community as well as affect change nationwide as well as the networking opportunities.
cons: Huge workload and pressure to produce results. The salary isn't great, especially given the the work load and many out of pocket expenditures required to achieve objectives.

pros: It was a lot of hard work, but totally worth it. The impact of the work in the community and the nation is admirable.
cons: Lots of sleepless nights. The people in upper management are very invested and you can feel that you can let them down easily.

review_title: A hands on experience in the political process. Very rewarding in substance.
job_title: Field Organizer in Santa Fe, NM
pros: you develop a robust network of individuals in your field who will help you out in the lifetime of your career.
cons: Monetary compensation is low. Average work week is 90-100+ hours

review_title: Hard work but for a worthy cause.
job_title: Field Organizer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Ample opportunities to meet members of the community and gain and abundance of skills in organizing people in a short time span. Work is varied and never dull.
cons: Long hours and often have to be very resourceful to accomplish goals.

review_title: My experiences with Obama for America was wonderful.  It was truly grassroots and a diverse group of people. Loved it.
pros: Was able to meet many different, like minded people.
cons: Sometimes people were there for self-interest not for the causes

pros: I really enjoyed working at OFA.  It was a very exciting and dynamic job.
cons: The hardest part of this job was the time required.  You work from morning to night but this is the norm for campaigns.

review_title: Great campaign experience with a very well run organization.
job_title: Field Organizer in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: The position included plenty of training exercises and is an excellent entry-level job. Continuous employee evaluation allowed for improvement and growth.
cons: None to speak of. Long hours and constantly changing projects are part of the campaign life.

pros: Project management. Self growth and development. Networking.
cons: Strict communication policies with management. No work-life balance; expect to fully immerse and dedicate yourself to the position.

review_title: And although it seems heaven sent / we ain't ready to see a black president
pros:
We changed the world.
Salary/benefits for field staff were competitive.
cons: It was exhausting, draining, frustrating, and difficult.  I felt inadequately trained sometimes.

pros:
Excellent team
Very interesting work and learnt a lot of how a campaign is run and what it entails
Got to see the president speak!
cons: No real cons, the team were all helpful and there was a fun atmosphere in the office

pros: This group was like a family. Grateful to have been in the trenches with the best of the best.
cons: Anybody who gets involved in a political campaign learns quickly that it's hard work and long hours. Totally worth it though!

review_title: Best work experience of my life.
job_title: Deputy Field Organizer in Bradenton, FL
pros: I worked with amazing people.  I met incredible volunteers.  I really a difference.
cons: The hours are just too much some times.  The work is seven days a week.

job_title: Software Developer in San Francisco, CA
pros: - great cause and relatively tech sophisticated for a political organization
cons:
- managers pretty hands off on projects
- paired with inexperienced engineer on project.  wouldn't listen to my concerns even though I knew more.

pros: Rewarding work. Get to work with intelligent and creative people from all over the place. Great pay and benefits as well.
cons: Long long long hours, it gets to you after a while.

pros: Learned a ton, met a bunch of friends, was given incredible opportunities after the election.
cons: Hours were terrible, but what can you say?  It was a campaign.

pros: Amazing meaningful role with a moving cause, loved my colleagues, made lifelong friendships, worked incredibly hard. Best job I have ever had. Proud to have done it.
cons: long hours and hard work

review_title: Best and worst thing I've ever done.
pros: We helped elect the president.
cons: I slept 3 hours a night and lost 15 pounds because I wasn't eating.

pros: Great insight on how the campaign works for a volunteer perspective
cons: Lavishly unrealistic demands, quotas that were expected. You were shunned if you didn't meet them. It was about quantity not quality.

pros: Good group of people partnering with others to make a positive difference in the United States.
cons: I found no serious issues with the organization or its work.

job_title: Social Media Strategist in Chicago, IL
pros: It felt great to be part of such an impactful organization.
cons: Loooong hours, meager pay--but that's to be expected for a political campaign.

pros:
Learned a lot from working with incredibly smart people.
Received a hug from POTUS.
cons: No work-life balance, but you knew what you were getting into.

review_title: Had a terrific time and learned a lot about politics.
pros: Satisfaction of electing a president.
cons: data centric campaign isn't about people or persuasion.

pros: Great contacts and learning potential!  They even provided full medical insurance.
cons: Long hours!  You spend a lot of time on the phone.

pros: You get to work to elect the next President of the United States
cons: Managers aren't trained and cannot give you the support you need to succeed.

pros: great organization, great training, great co workers, great cause
cons: long hours but worth it. Next to zero work life balance

pros: Great co-workers and atmosphere at the Tampa Office
cons: No work-life balance, ever. No sunshine.

pros: Great coworkers. challenging environment but supportive.
cons: No outside life. But fellow employees become social life

pros: best coworkers, best job, best work, best environment, best everything
cons: long hours, but worth it!

pros: Great cause, great networking, very supportive organization, and great resume builder.
cons: The pay is a bit low, but fantastic experience overall

pros: Great people, great vision, once in a lifetime opportunity.
cons: Low salary and all-consuming work. But totally worth it.

pros: Loved every minute; great experience.
cons: Sorry it had to end; although glad it ended with the election of President Obama.

pros: Work with incredible people doing incredible things.
cons: Campaigns are a hard lifestyle to sustain over a long period of time.

review_title: Great organization for those who are committed
pros: Work that meant something, challenging and rewarding.
cons: Incredibly challenging, no life balance, requires absolute commitment

review_title: Most memorable experience of career so far
pros: Inspiring, and incredible leadership and management training
cons: Thankless work at times, no frills environment.

pros: giving responsibility and leadership as you proved it
cons: did not allow for changes in messaging to target specific areas

pros:
lots of responsibility
great payoff
exciting opportunities every day
cons:
hard work/life balance
not so great pay but thats campaign life

pros: The skills I learned and the level of training was excellent
cons: Pay could have been better

pros: Great company culture and learning opportunity. Swift advancement. Great contacts for furture endeavors.
cons: Positions ended after election ended.

pros: One pro was the ability to learn more about campaign techniques
cons: Didn't like how condescending some interns were

pros: Great experience—good learning curve. Very challenging, but worth it
cons: There needs to be more management practice training.

pros: great great great great people to work for
cons: long hours! hard to keep an active lifestyle

pros: Fellow organizers, staff, and directors are passionate and great people
cons: No cons I can think of

pros: Worked in one of the most critical parts of the country
cons: Low pay of hours worked.

pros: Most Meaningful Work I have done.
cons: 7-day, 90-hour weeks were tough on friends and family.

pros: Working with the Obama team was wonderful
cons: Very long hours and metrics driven

pros: Great mission and colleagues trying to make things better
cons: The team could accomplish more

pros: Importance of work; talented co-workers; common goal
cons: hectic; can sometimes feel disorganized

pros: Creative and empowering place to work
cons: Short term length of operations

pros: great place to work for the year
cons: internships are hard to navigate

pros: Opportunity of a life time
cons:
No Pay
broke intern 
no

pros: Meeting interesting local people around.
cons: Long working time and outdoor work.
